newsitem.title: TRINIDAD AND TOBAGO: CRICKET-INDIA WIN TOSS, PUT WEST INDIES IN TO BAT.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-INDIA WIN TOSS, PUT WEST INDIES IN TO BAT.

text.p: India won the toss and put West Indies in to bat in the second one-day international at Queen's Park Oval on Sunday.
West Indies are fielding the team who won Saturday's rain-interrupted first one-dayer in Port of Spain by eight wickets while India have made three changes.

Middle order batsman Saurav Ganguly replaces all-rounder Robin Singh, Syed Karim comes in for injured wicketkeeper Nayan Mongia and off-spinning all-rounder Noel David replaces left-arm spinner Sunil Joshi.
The match was starting in extremely cloudy conditions and it looks as if rain could interrupt play later in the day.
West Indies - Stuart Williams, Shivnarine Chanderpaul, Brian Lara, Carl Hooper, Roland Holder, Jimmy Adams, Courtney Browne, Ian Bishop, Curtly Ambrose, Franklyn Rose, Courtney Walsh (captain).
India - Navjot Sidhu, Ajay Jadeja, Sachin Tendulkar (captain), Rahul Dravid, Mohammad Azharuddin, Saurav Ganguly, Syed Karim, Anil Kumble, Noel David, Abey Kuruvilla, Venkatesh Prasad.
